fr.insa.rennes.info.chemical.backend
Class BuilderIndexProviderImpl

java.lang.Object
  fr.insa.rennes.info.chemical.backend.BuilderIndexProviderImpl
All Implemented Interfaces:
BuilderIndexProvider
public class BuilderIndexProviderImpl
extends java.lang.Object
implements BuilderIndexProvider

Standard implementation of BuilderIndexProvider. Another implementation can be created by implementing BuilderIndexProvider.

Author:
Andréolli Cédric, Boulanger Chloé, Cléro Olivier, Guellier Antoine, Guilloux Sébastien, Templé Arthur

Constructor Detail

BuilderIndexProviderImpl

public BuilderIndexProviderImpl()
Constructs a standard builder for a IndexProvider. Initializes all the builder's parameters to null and the _complete field to false.

Method Detail

getProduct

public fr.insa.rennes.info.chemical.backend.IndexProvider getProduct()
                                                              throws ChemicalException
Description copied from interface: BuilderIndexProvider
Returns the built index provider, following the parameters given. The different parameters are the solution, the reaction rule, the reaction rule's field, and the increment strategy of the index provider. See the associated setters for a detailed description.

Specified by:
getProduct in interface BuilderIndexProvider
Returns:
The built index provider.
Throws:
ChemicalException
See Also:
BuilderIndexProvider.setReactionRule(ReactionRule), BuilderIndexProvider.setReactionRuleFields(Field[]), BuilderIndexProvider.setSolution(Solution), BuilderIndexProvider.setStrategy(Solution.Strategy)

setSolution

public void setSolution(Solution sol)
Description copied from interface: BuilderIndexProvider
Sets the solution parameter to build the index provider. The specified solution is the solution in which the index provider has to rely to provide indexes on the reactives asked by the reaction rule parameter.

Specified by:
setSolution in interface BuilderIndexProvider
Parameters:
sol - The solution on which the index provider has to iterate.

setReactionRule

public void setReactionRule(ReactionRule rr)
Description copied from interface: BuilderIndexProvider
Sets the reaction rule parameter to build the index provider. The reaction rule parameter specifies which reaction rule needs reactives.

Specified by:
setReactionRule in interface BuilderIndexProvider
Parameters:
rr - The reaction rule that needs the index provider.

setReactionRuleFields

public void setReactionRuleFields(java.lang.reflect.Field[] rrFields)
Description copied from interface: BuilderIndexProvider
Sets the reaction rule's fields parameter to build the index provider. These fields are the reactives needed by the reaction rule. Basically, these are the attributes of the reaction rule class, without the ones annotated Dontreact.

Specified by:
setReactionRuleFields in interface BuilderIndexProvider
Parameters:
rrFields - The reaction rule's fields
See Also:
Dontreact

setStrategy

public void setStrategy(Solution.Strategy strategy)
Description copied from interface: BuilderIndexProvider
Sets the iteration strategy parameter to build the index provider. The strategy determines in which order the reactives are given to the reaction rule. An ordered strategy will always give the same order of iteration and lead to the same execution result. A random strategy will allow indeterminism and possibly different results between two executions.

Specified by:
setStrategy in interface BuilderIndexProvider
Parameters:
strategy - The iteration's order/strategy.
See Also:
Solution.Strategy

build

public void build()
           throws ChemicalException
Processes to the building of the index provider. This functions first checks if all the parameters are instantiated, if not a ChemicalException explaining the issue is thrown.
The only operation is then to create a SubIndexProviderSolution builder to build the root SubIndexProviderSolution (see IndexProvider structure). If any error occurs during the building of the SubIndexProviderSolution, the error is directly reported. At the end, the product is declared as complete (_complete is set to true).
Note: the implementation used to build the IndexProvider is the standard implementation.

Throws:
ChemicalException
See Also:
IndexProvider, SubIndexProviderSolution, BuilderSubIndexProviderSolution
